Business Unit:Company Details:Job Details:Job Summary: The Corporate Tax and Audit manager will manage a team of analysts supporting corporate tax and audit. This role will work closely with the corporate tax director to enable a team of analysts to provide accurate and timely filing of corporate tax returns and maintain compliance with relevant tax laws and regulations and will also work closely with the corporate audit director and lead a team of audit analysts conducting audits, analyzing findings, and providing recommendations to improve processes and mitigate risks.This role is Hybrid, with US working hours. (2pm-11pm India) and will oversee 7-10 individuals.Essential Job Duties and Responsibilities:

Team Leadership: Lead and mentor a team of analysts fostering a collaborative and results-driven work environment. Provide guidance and support to team members, ensuring their professional growth and development.Operational Excellence: Coach the team to develop and implement streamlined processes and procedures to maximize efficiency and accuracy.  Monitor key performance metrics and take proactive measures to meet or exceed service level agreements.
 Client Relationships: Build and maintain strong relationships with co-leaders understanding their unique needs and providing exceptional service. Act as the main point of contact for inquiries, addressing concerns and ensuring satisfaction.Performance Management: Co-own performance evaluations for team members, providing constructive feedback and setting performance goals.  Identify training needs and coordinate relevant training programs to enhance team capabilities.Continuous Improvement:  Identify opportunities for process improvement and innovation, recommend and work closely with the leadership team to implement changes to enhance overall service quality and efficiency.Cross-functional Collaboration:  Collaborate with other departments within CAO and Finance, IT HR, and Legal to address operational and organizational needs.Minimum Job Requirements:Four-year college degree in Accounting or Finance with at least 5 to 7 years progressive public accounting experience and a Chartered Accountant certification. 
Minimum of 5 yearsâ€™ experience in audit and corporate tax to include managing tax and audit processes in a shared service set up for a US headquartered company. 
Diligent and strong attention to detail. Strong influencing skills, able to problem solve and find effective and timely resolutions.
Demonstrates excellent interpersonal skills with a willingness to share knowledge, coach and collaborate effectively with individuals and other departments.
Strong organization and planning skills with the ability to multitask and prioritize.
Prior experience in a manufacturing environment and service-based organization are highly desirable.
Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite or similar software and SAP highly desirable.  
Able to protect and handle confidential personnel information.  Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer required. Limited to travel including international.Condition of Employment:Successful outcome of a National Police Check and background check.The description provided above is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all job duties, responsibilities, and requirements.
